SEARCH
Module FinalProject
Package provided.rmiUtils.examples.hello_basic

Class ServerProcess

java.lang.Object
provided.rmiUtils.examples.hello_basic.ServerProcess
public class ServerProcess extends Object
Adapted from the Hello World" example from Sun. This class is the process that is hosting the RMI system and serving out RMI "Server" objects. This class is NOT an RMI Server instance!! SERVER MACHINE MUST HAVE REGISTRY_PORT AND SERVER_PORT (see below and RMIUtilsBasic) OPEN THROUGH FIREWALL!!

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Run the Server, which will find the RMI Registry, creating it if necessary, and bind an instance of the Server to the "Hello" name in the Registry. The server then stays in an infinite loop waiting for someone to use the bound server.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Start up the server

      args - Not used.
